danish_publication: Det var en gang, min fader og min faster Else her i Møltrup var gået ud og skulde lede om nogle kalve. Der var et treskjel, de kom til, og så vidste de ikke andet, end de kom til kalvene, men da de så nærmere til, var det en stor hvid, hovedløs stud. Else blev så bange, at hun faldt på knæ, og han sagde: "Jag til at læse din herrens bön, så vender a min vest avet." Da det var forrettet, løb de hjem ad, og så skyndte de dem at få rørt i ilden, inden de gik ind.
english_publication: Once my father and my paternal aunt Else here from Møltrup had gone out to look for some calves. They came to a three-way fork in the road, and then they came across the calves without knowing how, but when they looked closer, it was a big, white, headless steer. Else got so scared that she fell to her knees, and he said: "Quickly say the Our Father and I'll put my vest on backwards." When they'd done that, they ran home, and then they hurried up and made sure to stir in the fire before they went inside.
